programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les question Ashley's skills of diplomacy after observing her interact with several customers.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.sub-title: Sticks and Stones - But Please No Bones!
programme.desc: The judges have a bone to pick with the chefs in the signature round, no stone is left unturned for the crossfire round and the final sees them serving up some New Orleans food.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: Martin Bayerle investigates the 1909 shipwreck of RMS Republic, 50 miles off the coast of Nantucket, and attempts to prove the existence of her $1billion bounty.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The hunting season draws to a close, and the swampers struggle to fill their remaining tags before time runs out.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: For the first time all season Howie and Adam end up on the same BC wreck, and the old veteran doesn't like how the new guy is running the show.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and Chumlee are offered a Bugs Bunny poster signed by voice artist Mel Blanc, and also consider buying a golf club once owned by Dean Martin.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee shares his experience of running a successful pawn shop with Antwan, and the team values a rare Second World War artefact.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Ashley compete to sell the most goods, with the loser having to pay a forfeit. A musician with limited funds seeks a new bass to replace the one he has broken.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les argue over an important decision, while a scientist turns up in the shop claiming his vintage device can cure diseases.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The theory that aliens might have told Joan of Arc how to beat the English army, and whether an American serviceman received a message when he touched a spaceship.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The secret military aircraft constructed by armed forces in America, South Africa, Russia, Australia and Canada that resemble flying saucers, and have caused a stir with the locals.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: With previous dives ending in failure, Martin's son Grant offers up an alternative strategy to recover the treasure of the Republic.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Customers offer the team some spooky artefacts during Halloween, including a 19th-century vampire-killing kit and a set of equipment used in paranormal investigations.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team tries to get a good price on a fighter jet, as well as a baseball bat and glove signed by acclaimed player Babe Ruth.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff put a price on a 1940s mandolin, and try to determine if a signed print of Abraham Lincoln is genuine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered a poster signed by Steve McQueen, and examine a diary from the American Civil War - but have a hard time making sense of the writing.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to Moreno Valley, California and descend upon auctions at a facility that has been known for great scores.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy tries to hit a high pay-off with a low buy-in while Darrell and Brandon limp into a locker that may leave them all wet.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.sub-title: Sticks and Stones - But Please No Bones!
programme.desc: The judges have a bone to pick with the chefs in the signature round, no stone is left unturned for the crossfire round and the final sees them serving up some New Orleans food.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A couple try to exchange a pair of earrings for a promise ring, but Les declares the stones purchased for $1,000 as fake.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth intervenes in a confrontation between a customer and an employee in the car park, and is later given a 30th birthday surprise by his colleagues.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: Martin Bayerle makes one more attempt to recover the sunken treasure of The Republic.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Exploring the facts and myths behind Soviet-era extraterrestrial research programmes, which are claimed to have taken place at the Kapustin Yar cosmodrome, and the stories of UFO crashes in Russian folklore.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigating claims that the Third Reich used extraterrestrial technology, and a speculative report asking whether the legend of Atlantis could be a preserved memory of an ancient alien metropolis.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient astronaut theorists look at the Aborigine legend of Dreamtime, and ask if these stories hold the proof that aliens created life on Earth.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: A huge storm fails to halt the search for the valuable bluefin tuna, as some of the captains put the lives of their crew on the line by heading out in dangerous winds and high seas.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: Tension flares up quickly in the wildfire round, while the chefs must take the crossfire round with a grain of salt and the final is all about celebrating the Cape.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Hurricane Sandy hits America, cavers in California are caught in flash floods, and wild winds cause a hot air balloon crash in Canada.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: How poor training and a shocking event in the cockpit led to a routine flight from Moscow to Hong Kong falling out of the sky, and resulted in the deaths of everyone onboard.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head for San Diego in hopes of finding some south of the border treasure, and Rene and Casey step up to defend their home turf against Darrell.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene cannot control his excitement over a collector's unit, while Jarrod and Brandi look to hit quick and easy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Ashley compete to sell the most goods, with the loser having to pay a forfeit. A musician with limited funds seeks a new bass to replace the one he has broken.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les argue over an important decision, while a scientist turns up in the shop claiming his vintage device can cure diseases.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Gary Lineker hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with panellists Ross Noble and Samira Ahmed joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Seasoned rocker Alice Cooper, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? host Chris Tarrant and wildlife presenter Chris Packham compete to have their pet hates banished for ever, on the comedy panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include reality TV stars, balloon animals, parrots, Jedward, Chris Moyles and kids' artwork on fridges.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Joe Lycett, Phil Wang and Ellie Taylor join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig looks at the pastimes of past times. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Crackanory
programme.desc: A writer fabricates an elderly relative to get time off work to start his novel - but his lie comes to life. Told by Sheridan Smith.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle travel around the country to complete a variety of outlandish stunts, beginning with an attempt to bounce a man across a lake and into a target.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Turin, Italy, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: A new couple rub Brandon and Lori up the wrong way and bid on some knock-off Hollywood costumes.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori are confused by a 3D printer, but are delighted with the valuation, while Papa Bear bids on two mysterious lots from Brazil.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank meet a couple who have been collecting unusual items since the 1960s, and Danielle brings a rare scooter into the garage.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event in Peru, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event which comes from the Cauberg, a hill in the southern town of Valkenburg, Holland.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Actress Beattie Edmondson, journalist Amol Rajan, presenter Gaby Roslin and comedian Hugh Dennis take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games. Their scores are tallied from across the week resulting in an overall champion being crowned.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell is joined by comic actor Greg Davies and TV presenter Konnie Huq, while Lee Mack teams up with former cricketer Phil Tufnell and comedian Marcus Brigstocke, as the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon continues.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Another chance to see Stephen Fry presenting a Children in Need edition of the irreverent quiz show in which points are rewarded to the most interesting answers to obtuse questions. Featuring contestants Bill Bailey, Jo Brand, Jeremy Clarkson and Alan Davies, with a guest appearance from Pudsey Bear.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff heads to Iceland to compete in the world's maddest motorsport, while Paddy McGuinness gets to grips with the latest Toyota Supra. Chris Harris investigates the story of the Lotus 79, arguably the most beautiful F1 car of all time.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond and James May try to make a space shuttle out of a Reliant Robin, while Jeremy Clarkson puts the Porsche 911 Turbo through its paces. The Stig takes to the track in a Mercedes SL, and actor Simon Pegg opts for a more modest vehicle as the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Liza Tarbuck still leads the pack of five comics, as Russell Howard wraps a tie round his head and Tim Vine is left bereft by a small piece of bent metal.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Actress Beattie Edmondson, journalist Amol Rajan, presenter Gaby Roslin and comedian Hugh Dennis take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games. Their scores are tallied from across the week resulting in an overall champion being crowned.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Actor Larry Lamb, comedian David O'Doherty and presenter Lauren Laverne join host Frank Skinner, making the case for their pet hates to be banished for ever. The trio's dislikes include high fives, fancy dress, ostentatious dresses, being 35, fake tan and square plates.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Another chance to see Stephen Fry presenting a Children in Need edition of the irreverent quiz show in which points are rewarded to the most interesting answers to obtuse questions. Featuring contestants Bill Bailey, Jo Brand, Jeremy Clarkson and Alan Davies, with a guest appearance from Pudsey Bear.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Gina Yashere, Lost Voice Guy, Ed Gamble
programme.desc: Gina Yashere comperes the comedy show at London's Hammersmith Apollo. She warms up the audience before introducing routines by 2018 Britain's Got Talent winner Lost Voice Guy and Mock the Week regular Ed Gamble.

programme.title: Big Zuu's Big Eats
programme.desc: Big Zuu is going regal as he heads to Royal Leamington Spa to meet and eat with comedian and actor Guz Khan. Leamington was once a place Queen Victoria visited, now it's the mandems turn.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Tim Vine attempts a risky impersonation, Alex Horne receives a gift from Liza Tarbuck, and the recipient of the Taskmaster's golden bonce trophy is revealed.

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: The comedian visits countries that are rarely visited by tourists to get a sense of the local culture and find out if they deserve their reputation. His first destination is Haiti, a country mostly famous for a dictatorship and a series of natural disasters. Accompanied by journalist Jeremy Dupin, he visits the iron market, attends vodou ceremonies, and explores a cathedral destroyed by an earthquake.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Extended edition. Comedian, writer and actress Katherine Ryan guest hosts the satirical quiz, with stand-up Joe Wilkinson and broadcaster and writer Gyles Brandreth joining regular team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to poke fun at the week's news.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how Stalin's massive war factories were dismantled and moved east on one and half million railway trucks, to avoid being lost to the Nazis.

programme.title: From World War to Cold War
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring the end of the Second World War, and how the plans for the future agreed by the Allied nations at the Yalta Conference in 1945 broke down.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: From World War to Cold War
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary exploring the end of the Second World War, and how the plans for the future agreed by the Allied nations at the Yalta Conference in 1945 broke down.

programme.title: Coast
programme.sub-title: Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
programme.desc: Neil Oliver leads the team to Cornwall and discovers the network of communication cables under Porthcurno beach. Miranda Krestovnikoff discovers how a shipwreck can be turned into a natural wildlife sanctuary, and Mark Horton visits the Isles of Scilly - known to some archaeologists as the Isles of the Dead.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston uncovers the truth behind James Bond, revealing what elements of the character were drawn from creator Ian Fleming's own experiences.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The capture and subsequent suicide of Heinrich Himmler. One of Hitler's most feared allies, his earlier reign of persecution had resulted in the deaths of millions of people.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Bolsover Castle in Derbyshire. Finds on display include original illustrations for Roald Dahl's book Fantastic Mr Fox, a set of motorcyclist Barry Sheene's racing leathers, a collection of Star Wars toys, a mysterious metal rod that proves to be far more valuable than it appears and a miniature house used for training plumbers. A visitor to the show tries to find a glass figure for her mother, to replace one that exploded.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The stories behind the most important trains in history and their impact on the world, beginning with a look at the first locomotives during the Industrial Revolution.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A strange-looking town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two episodes from Bolsover Castle in Derbyshire. Items brought in to be valued include a painting by DH Lawrence, a broken pot with a connection to the abolition of slavery, a 19th-century pistol, a collection of vintage hats, a complete set of Famous Five books and a rare jade pendant dug up in the garden of a 17th-century house.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how fleas are able to jump great distances for their size and attempts to discover how fast a cheetah can run.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores animals that have developed tool-making skills to help them survive, including orangutans and crows.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at vibrantly coloured monkeys in Venezuela, Costa Rica and West Africa. He encounters the red howler, which boasts one of the loudest calls in the wild, a capuchin that uses a tree as an anvil, the guenon, which communicates via facial expression, and the ground-dwelling gelada baboon.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The railroads ended slavery in the USA, but trains can be agents of oppression too. The British Empire built railways to rule the world, enabling it to control the empire.

programme.title: Wartime Crime
programme.desc: Documentary about criminals in Britain during the Second World War, beginning with how London gangster William Charles Hill made his mark on the Black Market.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering and examining hidden structures built by the Nazis, from tunnels to towers, artillery sites, resistance nests and communication centres. The first edition focuses on the Channel Island of Guernsey, which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Ruins from the time before the fall of the Berlin Wall, including a covert Communist base that hid Cold War submarines for Tito and the former HQ of the Soviet Army in East Germany.

programme.title: Secrets of the Solar System
programme.desc: What life is really like on Venus, where the clouds are full of acid and the temperature is the same even at the poles, having undergone catastrophic climate change.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek dives into the lost Jowett marque, as a Bradford-built 1952 Javelin finds an unexpected home. Paul and Dave uncover a Ford Escort that's been untouched for 30 years.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Anglophile Derek struggles to get his message across on a rare trip abroad to pick up a Bentley, while a well-restored Ford XR2 sets the auction alight.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam Ryan investigates the grisly discovery of a severed arm following a traffic collision, assisted by new morgue colleague Leo Dalton. As DCI Deacon arrives at the scene, Sam notices she is expressing an unusual interest in one of the bodies, leading her to believe her colleague could be withholding an important piece of evidence. Meanwhile, new junior pathologist Harry Cunningham faces a trying time when he finds out his first autopsy will be performed on a child.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: A pretender to the throne is held captive at court, confounding the Tudors, and creating a new rift in Lizzie and King Henry's marriage. Lizzie faces an impossible choice, and makes a risky move to try to eliminate the threat to her family. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The pretender exposes King Henry's weaknesses, while Lizzie confronts new demons and old curses. Concluding the sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages as the War of the Roses comes to an end. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The men take part in a training exercise in dealing with chemical weapons, and the arrival of a new soldier in the regiment brings trouble.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Joy plans a party for the girls while the men are on their training exercise at the Army training ground. Meanwhile, Dave Tucker opens up about feeling depressed.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: David Kent returns home unexpectedly and catches wife-to-be Sheelagh going through his belongings. Realising time is running out, he resorts to desperate measures and tries to kill the real Gabriel. Later, as a horrified June looks on, he and Smithy settle their differences once and for all - in a life-or-death struggle on the roof of a tower block.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: The hospital holds an emergency drill to see how the staff would cope with a terrorist attack, but tensions within the team prove a barrier to them working well together. Joseph is put under pressure by Lord Byrne, and responds by taking an overdose of the drugs he has been taking to control his obsessive compulsive disorder.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Barney is aghast to learn health assistant Spencer knows about his alcoholic father, and wastes no time in accusing Chloe of telling tales. Meanwhile, Duffy confides in Colette that she may be pregnant again, a group of students holds a teacher hostage in a derelict house and a patient unwittingly brings a black widow spider into the department. Medical drama, starring Ben Keaton, Ronnie McCann and Catherine Shipton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Leela investigates a 'happy slapping' incident. Tracing the teenage culprits to a nearby school, she finds they show no remorse. Amber, Ramani and Zain look into a case of domestic violence, only to find the circumstances aren't as clear-cut as they initially appeared. Back at the station, Dan Casper is teased about his seemingly non-existent love life, and Adam tries to quell gossip about the bogus Gabriel Kent's fatal fall.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil has moved into his new flat and he has a proposition for Kathy.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian wants to take Cindy on a romantic night out and Ricky tries his hand at selling cars.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Three months after the crash, the Blue Watch team has returned to duty, just in time to deal with an inferno on a private railway line.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Idealistic GP Jack Kerruish tries to help a childless couple _ and learns a harsh lesson on the realities of country life. Medical drama, starring Amanda Burton and Kevin Whately.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A patient's wife accuses Sally of having an affair with her husband, putting pressure on the nurse's career and marriage, while Nathan and Joe find out the truth about Alice's two-timing and a bored Alan discovers he has won the star prize on a scratch card. Ex-EastEnder Martin Kemp guest stars.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Dorien takes her antique silver samovar to the Antiques Roadshow, inspiring the sisters to search for their own family heirlooms - and soon they make a surprising discovery.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Tyler falls into a deep depression after his girlfriend leaves him, spending every hour painting gloomy pictures and starving himself. Marlene enlists Jed and Bryan to help her son mend his broken heart, but when matters do not improve, the responsibility falls to her mother, Dora. Guest starring June Whitfield.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Why Does Norman Clegg Buy Ladies' Elastic Stockings?
programme.desc: Howard asks a reluctant Clegg to deliver a message to Marina at her place of employment. Meanwhile, Seymour goes in search of oil, but manages to drill through a water main. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Michael Aldridge.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour takes it upon himself to supervise repairs to a boat, and together with Clegg tries to persuade Compo to take up canoeing to improve his physique. Comedy, starring Michael Aldridge, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank and Luella race against the clock when undertaker Peter Quintus is given only 24 hours to live after a visit by two mysterious hitmen - Mr R and Mr G.

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: A volunteer in the Lighthaven lifeboat crew drowns following a hoax call-out, and Jane suspects foul play, despite Davey's scepticism.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Back home in Bermondsey for his youngest daughter's wedding, Gerry is visited by Ralph Paxton, an old friend recently released from prison who wants him investigate the murder of his grandson. Meanwhile, a newly divorced Sasha is forced to work with ex-husband Ned Hancock, Danny puts the body language skills he has acquired on an FBI course to the test, and Gerry's daughter Caitlin gets upset when her father interrogates her fiance about his credentials. Cold case drama, starring Dennis Waterman, Tamzin Outhwaite and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a guest appearance by David Hayman (Trial & Retribution).

credits.actor: a guest appearance by David Hayman (Trial & Retribution)

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam is called in to investigate the murders of a ruthless businessman and his family, but still finds time for romance with an old flame. Meanwhile, a preoccupied Leo unwittingly puts his reputation on the line by dismissing a junior pathologist's doubts concerning the seemingly routine death of an elderly woman. Feature-length episode, starring Amanda Burton and Tom Ward.

programme.sub-title: Scammers: Hunting the Lockdown Criminals - Tonight

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer buys a 1974 Ferrari Dino, but has to wait for Edd China to restore it before he can sell it on for a profit.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton hopes to make some money selling props to Hollywood producers who require genuine military vehicles for a movie shoot.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part one of two. Paul Jr makes a decision that could end his estrangement from Paul Sr. Meanwhile, PJD starts a build for Skil Tools and OCC works on a bike based on a sports car.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: How the Luftwaffe was reborn during the Cold War to defend the skies of Western Europe, as pilots dominated with fighters such as the Messerschmitt BF-109 and Focke Wulf.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe takes animal hides and helps to convert them into paper vellums in New York's Hudson Valley.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew explores how the Aston Martin Vanquish was made.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew visits the birthplace of the classic Zenvo ST1, and conduct a in-depth analysis of the vehicle's luxury body-work.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How to make modern violins that sound as good as the legendary Stradivarius. Plus, how houses are built out of volcanic rock.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and motorcycle restorer Sam Lovegrove head to Herefordshire, where they discover sheds full of engines, autogyros and weird and wonderful vehicles of all kinds, before coming away with a British classic.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove drive on to Gloucestershire to uncover some oily treasure. They find a picturesque farm where deer, goats and pigs rub shoulders with vintage agricultural equipment. But can they make a quick return on today's find?.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The crew members of the Wizard face a life-or-death situation when a deckhand collapses, while on the Ramblin' Rose Elliott Neese receives an ultimatum from his boss.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Rookies battle broken hoses and finally hit treasure. Meanwhile, at their wash plant, the Cooke Brothers race to beat the worst drought in a decade.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Bristol, the iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge is shut down while the tollbooths are updated. Plus, a vintage Jaguar is pulled from scrap and converted into a banger racer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a Ford Mustang Fastback and gives it to mechanic Edd China to restore, as the duo hope to turn the wreck into a machine worth more than £20,000

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini decides to buy a 1956 Porsche 356 Cabriolet on the recommendation of a friend.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini fixes a clients 1962 Triumph TR4 racing car for sale, and after months of negotiations he collects a 1963 250 GTL Ferrari Lusso.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: An insight into the design of the Mercedes AMG GT, which was conceived as a faster, lighter and smaller hand-built supercar to rival the venerable Porsche 911.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Rookies battle broken hoses and finally hit treasure. Meanwhile, at their wash plant, the Cooke Brothers race to beat the worst drought in a decade.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Wizard crew calls in a Coast Guard helicopter as they scramble to help the collapsed greenhorn, while the rest of the fleet races to haul crab before a hurricane strikes.

programme.title: Explosions Gone Wrong
programme.desc: Experts examine the science behind big blasts and suggest how they can be prevented. Featuring footage of exploding buildings, roads, trains and other vehicles.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard examines furniture in a Black Country factory. Next, in Derby, a new contact pays off when he finds the crankshaft from a Battle of Britain fighter plane.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In south Cambridgeshire, an iconic 62-metre tower takes its final bow. In Gloucestershire, a broken digger causes problems, and in Sussex the team gets creative.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer searches for a Ferrari 308 GT4 within his budget, and when he secures one hopes that Edd China is up to the task of restoring it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer buys a 1974 Ferrari Dino, but has to wait for Edd China to restore it before he can sell it on for a profit.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Rookies Justin and Becky risk their lives underground, desperate for a find. Meanwhile, opal hunting legend Col Duff returns on the hunt for long-forgotten treasure.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a dealer in Manchester, haggles with a windmill manager in Kent and seeks artefact redemption at a Somerset abbey. Plus, he moves shop after 10 years in one place.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: After Nasa's New Horizons spacecraft flies by Pluto, it encounters a mysterious object that shuts down the probe's computers. Experts investigate what it could be.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: Vast gold resources lie among south east Asia's island rivers, but they are also home to crocodiles, and locals need the help of professional to extract the valuable ore.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Transforming weeds into walls using a substance made out of hemp and concrete. Plus, how skydiving suits help people fly, and the production of the Swedish fish dish surstromming.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The mining of precious opals beneath a hot desert, the making of nougat and how stunt planes are built.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China try to transform a Mini City 1000 to celebrate the car's 50th anniversary on a budget of £5,000

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. After buying a Mini City 1000 for £700, Mike Brewer plans to showcase the car at the three-day 50th birthday celebration of the vehicle in Birmingham. The only problem is that mechanic Edd China still has to complete the work necessary to restore it to its former glory.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Three cases in which investigators employed forensic science in tracking, apprehending and convicting serial killers.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 43-year-old Pennsylvania DJ Ervin Holton, who in November 2012 was shot dead on his friend's porch. With no witnesses, police turned to security cameras located opposite for clues.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Erica Vassell, who disappeared after a party in Clewiston, Florida. When her brutally murdered body was found days later, friends were left in shock and fear.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A fatal shootout ensues when the millionaire father of a kidnap victim tries to hand over the ransom money demanded for her release.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A team of investigators responds to reports of animal cruelty, rescuing pets and dealing with abusive owners.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown helps celebrity bull Bully, whose horn is growing into its head, and it is discovered that turtles are starving off the coast of Cairns.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A five-week-old puppy is struggling to walk, a cat and a snake are brought into the clinic after having a fierce fight and a water dragon causes mayhem.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kristy has lost seven stone and is looking for the right dress to show off her new figure, while Kristin, who has shed almost three stone, is excited to fit into dress samples.

programme.title: Say Yes: Wedding SOS
programme.desc: George tries to save the day for Brittany and Justin, who were just one month away from their wedding date when a fire destroyed everything they had.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Pluto the singing dog is having problems with his voice, causing concern for Dr Chris. Tim tackles a territorial Tasmanian Devil, and can Lisa save a desperately ill kitten?.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown meets Monty, the kid goat that cannot stop scratching, and Lisa treats a terrified German shepherd puppy. A feisty 42-year-old galah has an unappetising problem.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: The team receives a midnight call-out and discovers hundreds of mistreated animals, including more than 200 birds, dogs and roosters.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: Members of the team rescue a cat trapped in a drain deep underground, and help an abandoned dog in danger of freezing to death.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A college student is murdered on her way home from work, while a Michigan woman disappears after accepting her dream job.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 30-year-old teacher and former beauty queen Tara Grinstead, who vanished from her Georgia home on October 24, 2005. An abandoned latex glove was found in her backyard and police learned she had enjoyed a complex series of relationships with men.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 17-year-old Kara Kopetsky, who failed to return home from her Missouri school in May 2007. As the investigation proceeded a few unsettling clues occurred - a restraining order was required against an ex-boyfriend, unconfirmed sightings were made in a nearby town and another local girl disappeared.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: When April Barber was murdered at a remote Florida beauty spot, her husband Justin said he tried to stop the killer and even appealed for help on television. Experts analyse the deception in his words and deeds of August 2002.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Indian bride Rashi wants an American-style gown, while Shenelle returns for her fitting, nervous about seeing her custom dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Krystle is getting married to baseball player Ryan Howard and wants to find the perfect dress, while Southern belle Deshae looks for something with glitz, beads and sparkle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Katie is looking for a dress to celebrate her new beginning following a lung transplant, while Christy comes in for her first fitting after losing more than 11 stone.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Even after gaining confidence from losing weight, Victoria still seeks her mother's approval on her dress, while Lauren and her mum disagree on styles of gowns.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Trisha's father helps her pick out a dress, while Caitlin has her fitting now that her dad is well enough to attend.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Crystal seeks a dress designed by Pnina Tornai, while Deborah feels a strong connection with Diana, Princess of Wales, and is determined to have her own royal wedding.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three collectors spend a day at Porte de Vanves flea market in Paris with expert Mark Franks, before upcycling their items and selling their wares in Clapham, south London.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Boss James Constantinou and the team appraise more items brought along by members of the public. A divorcee from Newcastle wants to sell her £185,000 necklace to pay for her children's private-school fees, a crystal-covered drum kit used on a Kylie Minogue tour catches the eye of staff member Patrick, and a widowed pensioner hopes to make a fortune from her precious rings. Plus, a valuation doesn't come easy to the experts when a client turns up with a 7ft Terminator model.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A mother is forced to change her own lifestyle as well as that of her 26-year-old son Sean, who weighs over 700lbs.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: When Anne Searle confronted her husband about his sordid affair, he strangled her to death in their home. Detectives explore the steps that led to her murder.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: The case of Brian Cargill, who when he divorced his wife, thought it was the end of a bad episode. However, he then found himself in a battle to save his son from her wrath.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: After being reported missing, a young couple's bodies were discovered more than 60 miles apart. Dedicated investigators set out to find their killer.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The work of investigators and scientists at the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms who are dedicated to preventing terrorism and reducing violent crime.
